content:
• Tuesday, September 13, 2011
  • AOBC

    Smith & Wesson (SWHC) boosts its FY12 guidance, now saying revenue will be $415M to $430M,...

    Smith & Wesson (SWHC) boosts its FY12 guidance, now saying revenue will be $415M to $430M, versus Street estimates of $420M. Shares +3.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • PTE

    Majesco Entertainment (COOL) handily beats on its Q3, reporting a profit of $19.5M, a 59% leap...

    Majesco Entertainment (COOL) handily beats on its Q3, reporting a profit of $19.5M, a 59% leap Y/Y, and better than analyst estimates of $18 mln. The company guides FY11 higher, putting it in-line with Street estimates. Shares +2.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM
  • CQP

    Cheniere Energy Partners (NYSEMKT:CQP) announces a secondary offering of 3.7M common units...

    Cheniere Energy Partners (NYSEMKT:CQP) announces a secondary offering of 3.7M common units representing L.P. interest. Shares -3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • FDX

    FedEx (FDX +1.82%) held on to gains today, shaking off an earlier downgrade by RBC on concerns...

    FedEx (FDX +1.82%) held on to gains today, shaking off an earlier downgrade by RBC on concerns that slowing global growth will cut into package shipping and delivery demand. RBC cut the stock to sector perform, saying as demand remains volatile over the next few quarters, it could negatively impact earnings.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • DELL-OLD

    Dell (DELL-OLD) is up 2.3% AH after the company's board authorizes another $5B in share...

    Dell (DELL-OLD) is up 2.3% AH after the company's board authorizes another $5B in share repurchases, on top of the $2.16B remaining from prior authorizations. Dell, which had over $16.2B in cash and investments at the end of its FQ2, has been among the most aggressive large-cap tech names with regards to share repurchases.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • CAG

    Ralcorp (RAH) is down 9.4% AH after ConAgra (NYSE:CAG) announces it will withdraw its $94/share...

    Ralcorp (RAH) is down 9.4% AH after ConAgra (NYSE:CAG) announces it will withdraw its $94/share bid for Ralcorp, which the latter rejected, unless the two firms are "engaged in a constructive dialogue satisfactory to ConAgra" by Sep. 19. CAG is down 1.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • CIEN

    Ciena (CIEN +8.3%) shares surge after George Soros' hedge fund reported a 4.99% passive stake in...

    Ciena (CIEN +8.3%) shares surge after George Soros' hedge fund reported a 4.99% passive stake in the maker of networking gear, according to an SEC filing after yesterday's close.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • EW

    Edwards Lifesciences (EW +3.2%) is outperforming after the drug developer's board authorizes a...

    Edwards Lifesciences (EW +3.2%) is outperforming after the drug developer's board authorizes a new $500M share repurchase program. As of June 30, Edwards had about $240M remaining on a prior $500M program. The company expects to repurchase $100M in shares in Q3.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • RIG

    Transocean (RIG +3%) sets a bullish tone for energy stocks, as Argus Research says the planned...

    Transocean (RIG +3%) sets a bullish tone for energy stocks, as Argus Research says the planned $1.4B purchase of Aker Drilling will help its deepwater drilling business. RIG "is acquiring the fleet at a modest discount to fair value," Argus says. Also, Hess (HES +2.8%) shoots higher after CEO John Hess buys $10M worth of its shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • MTGE

    American Capital Mortgage (MTGE +2.6%) holds on to gains late in the day after Deutsche...

    American Capital Mortgage (MTGE +2.6%) holds on to gains late in the day after Deutsche initiated the shares with a buy earlier on valuation with a $21 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • SORL

    SORL Auto Parts (SORL +2.8%) continues moving higher in the last hour of trading after saying...

    SORL Auto Parts (SORL +2.8%) continues moving higher in the last hour of trading after saying earlier it's entered into an agreement with China's largest trucking manufacturer to supply braking valves and components.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • CY

    Spansion (CODE +2.7%) is the latest chip company to lower its outlook, but the market doesn't...

    Spansion (CODE +2.7%) is the latest chip company to lower its outlook, but the market doesn't seem to care. Several firms - ISIL, TXN, ALTR, FCS - recently have issued reduced or soft guidance, yet shares have held up. Investors appear to have shifted focus to 2012, and expectations for a soft second half already may be priced into chip shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • PHG

    Philips Electronics NV (PHG +4.8%) continues to climb after raising its cost savings targets and...

    Philips Electronics NV (PHG +4.8%) continues to climb after raising its cost savings targets and confirming its 2013 forecasts in the face a weakening global economy. The company also reaffirms its intention to step up additional investments in R&D.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • OSGB

    Transportation stocks are steady gainers on the day with all 20 stocks listed in the Dow Jones...

    Transportation stocks are steady gainers on the day with all 20 stocks listed in the Dow Jones Industrial Transportation Average moving higher. Not getting left out of the party are shipping stocks (SEA +2.2%), led by OSG +9.2%, PRGN +4.2%, FRO +3.6% and DRYS +2.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • FRO

    Frontline (FRO +3.5%) gains after saying, along with partner Shipping Finance, it will terminate...

    Frontline (FRO +3.5%) gains after saying, along with partner Shipping Finance, it will terminate its long term charters and sell the single-hull VLCCs Titan Orion, Titan Aries and Titan Ocean.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • SOL

    ReneSola (SOL +1.1%) is higher today after reporting progress on its stock buyback. The company...

    ReneSola (SOL +1.1%) is higher today after reporting progress on its stock buyback. The company says it's repurchased about 645K ADR's, while its CEO Xianshou Li separately purchased around 1.1M shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • NTDOY

    Nintendo (OTCPK:NTDOY -4.5%) says it will add features to its 3DS to allow users to record...

    Nintendo (OTCPK:NTDOY -4.5%) says it will add features to its 3DS to allow users to record movies in 3-D, introduce a pink version of the device to attract women, and launch new Mario titles, but disappointed analysts say they're not enough for the company to meet its targets during the holiday shopping season even after recent price cuts of as much as 40%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • MON

    Monsanto (MON +2.9%) is trading higher today after being upgraded to buy on valuation at Chardan...

    Monsanto (MON +2.9%) is trading higher today after being upgraded to buy on valuation at Chardan with an $85 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • CVI

    A number of oil refiners are moving lower today. While NYMEX crude is up 2.3%. the "crack...

    A number of oil refiners are moving lower today. While NYMEX crude is up 2.3%. the "crack spread' between crude and refined oil prices is down over 5%, a negative for refiners. CVI -5.5%. HFC -6.4%. WNR -5.6%. TSO -1.9%. DK -1.4%. MPC -2.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM
  • VELTF

    Velti (VELT) is up 19.2% after getting tagged with a double-digit loss yesterday on worries...

    Velti (VELT) is up 19.2% after getting tagged with a double-digit loss yesterday on worries about its European sales. The seemingly overdone swings in the share price of the mobile marketing and advertising firm may get cleared up later this month when the firm hosts a Financial Analyst Day.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • CSCO

    More on Cisco's (NASDAQ:CSCO) analyst day: The company is cutting its sales growth forecast for...

    More on Cisco's (NASDAQ:CSCO) analyst day: The company is cutting its sales growth forecast for the next 3 years to 5-7%, below a prior long-term forecast of 12-17%. Cisco expects its addressable market to grow 7-8% during this time, with strong growth in wireless, virtuallization, and collaboration offset by switching and routing weakness. Shares are now up 2.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • LXRX

    Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (LXRX +1.6%) trades up today after it reports positive results from a...

    Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (LXRX +1.6%) trades up today after it reports positive results from a recently completed clinical trial of its diabetes drug LX4211.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • VVUS

    VIVUS (VVUS +1.6%) is up on positive results from its avanafil phase 3 study. The companys says...

    VIVUS (VVUS +1.6%) is up on positive results from its avanafil phase 3 study. The companys says male diabetics receiving the drug had significant improvement in erectile function.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • NETL

    NetLogic (NETL +0.2%) shares are quiet a day after Broadcom's (BRCM) $3.7B bid, as investor...

    NetLogic (NETL +0.2%) shares are quiet a day after Broadcom's (BRCM) $3.7B bid, as investor hopes for a higher competing bid fade. But Cavium (CAVM +3.2%) and EZChip (EZCH +6.5%) extend yesterday's speculative surge: JMP thinks CAVM could be a takeover target and the BRCM-NETL combo could add new business (also), and Bloomberg reports Marvell (NASDAQ:MRVL) could make a bid for EZCH.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • AAXN

    TASER International (TASR +1.1%) gets a jolt after it announces an order for 200 TASER X26...

    TASER International (TASR +1.1%) gets a jolt after it announces an order for 200 TASER X26 electronic control devices and related accessories by an unnamed U.S. federal government agency.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • HCA

    Shares of HCA Holdings (HCA -3.6%) fall after the company reported fewer heart procedures in Q2...

    Shares of HCA Holdings (HCA -3.6%) fall after the company reported fewer heart procedures in Q2 due to its lower number of physicians on staff. Cowen downgraded shares to Neutral from Outperform, saying government pricing concerns "keeps them on the sidelines."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • SPPI

    Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (SPPI +3.5%) trades higher after initiating its $25M stock buyback. The...

    Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (SPPI +3.5%) trades higher after initiating its $25M stock buyback. The repurchase program is expected to remain in effect through the end of 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • INO

    Inovio Pharmaceuticals (INO +7.3%) says early data from a Phase I study assessing its PENNVAX-G...

    Inovio Pharmaceuticals (INO +7.3%) says early data from a Phase I study assessing its PENNVAX-G global HIV vaccine demonstrated "strong immune responses and safety."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM
  • AAL

    More on airline stocks (previous): Carriers continue to add more guidance for investors to chew...

    More on airline stocks (previous): Carriers continue to add more guidance for investors to chew on, as the outlook starts to shape up better than the complete H2 slowdown analysts forecast. American Airlines (AMR +5.4%) says with corporate travel steady it will trim Q4 flights just slightly, while United (UAL +5.3%) sees more international flights offsetting a dip in domestic capacity.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • HUN

    Shares of Huntsman (HUN +4.9%) are rallying today, after S&P Ratings Service upgraded the...

    Shares of Huntsman (HUN +4.9%) are rallying today, after S&P Ratings Service upgraded the company a notch to BB- on expectations that stronger demand and better pricing will improve operating performance.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • HMA

    Health Management Associates (HMA +1.7%) gains on an Oppenheimer upgrade to outperform, saying...

    Health Management Associates (HMA +1.7%) gains on an Oppenheimer upgrade to outperform, saying the company has a strong management team and general weakness in the hospital sector is overdone.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • AAL

    Shares of U.S. Airways (LCC) are up 18% on high trading volume, as the prospect of "continued...

    Shares of U.S. Airways (LCC) are up 18% on high trading volume, as the prospect of "continued capacity discipline" carries weight with investors and provides a big lift to the entire sector. Also kicking in on the positive side for carriers is the potential for a little margin relief with an outlook for higher fares and lower fuel prices. Gainers: DAL +9%, AMR +5.7%, UAL +5.5%, LUV +5.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • GWR

    Genesee & Wyoming (GWR +2.7%) carload traffic rose again in August, marking four and a half...

    Genesee & Wyoming (GWR +2.7%) carload traffic rose again in August, marking four and a half straight years of increases. The railroad operator's largest commodity group, coal and coke, increased 7.5% Y/Y. The data contrasts with RailAmerica's (NYSE:RA-OLD) earlier report, which said traffic dropped in August for the fifth straight month because of a big decline in coal, its top commodity as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • COG

    Cabot Oil (COG -2.5%) dips after CapitalOne Southcoast cuts it to add on valuation, saying its...

    Cabot Oil (COG -2.5%) dips after CapitalOne Southcoast cuts it to add on valuation, saying its strong asset value and production potential has already been priced into the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM

  • Israeli pharmaceutical company BioLine RX (BLRX +39%) rockets after reporting positive...

    Israeli pharmaceutical company BioLine RX (BLRX +39%) rockets after reporting positive early-stage results for its drug candidate BL-1021, an orally administered treatment for neuropathic pain.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • JPM

    JPMorgan Chase (JPM +1.9%) jumps to the top of the Dow leader board after Stifel Nicolaus puts a...

    JPMorgan Chase (JPM +1.9%) jumps to the top of the Dow leader board after Stifel Nicolaus puts a Buy rating on the shares, saying the bank is undervalued after falling 25% since May. But JPM scales back its own outlook, saying market revenue will be down from Q2 and investment banking fees will total a less-than-expected $1B for the current quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • AMD

    Advanced Micro Devices (AMD +0.9%) spin-off Spansion (CODE -2.3%) cuts its FQ3 revenue guidance,...

    Advanced Micro Devices (AMD +0.9%) spin-off Spansion (CODE -2.3%) cuts its FQ3 revenue guidance, citing softness in the wireless and consumer markets. The company now says wireless products will account for less than 10% of total revenue due to an unexpected decline in demand and pricing.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • UMPQ

    Umpqua Holdings (UMPQ +5.1%) gets a boost this morning from a Stifel Nicolaus upgrade to buy....

    Umpqua Holdings (UMPQ +5.1%) gets a boost this morning from a Stifel Nicolaus upgrade to buy. Stifel says the company is well positioned for future growth after expanding its branch operations, plus it has a strong loan portfolio.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • CCE-OLD

    Coca-Cola Enterprises (CCE-OLD +2.9%) is moving higher after UBS upgrades the bottler to Buy,...

    Coca-Cola Enterprises (CCE-OLD +2.9%) is moving higher after UBS upgrades the bottler to Buy, while maintaining a $30 PT. UBS thinks concerns about rising input costs, European instability, consumer health worries, and a proposed French soda tax are overdone, and that the company can post 2011 growth above its long-term targets.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • EXLS

    ExlService Holdings (EXLS -9.6%) is lower this morning after announcing a 4M share secondary...

    ExlService Holdings (EXLS -9.6%) is lower this morning after announcing a 4M share secondary offering, with 3M shares being offered by select stockholders and another 1M shares to be sold by the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • NDSN

    Nordson (NDSN +3.2%) pops after its board authorizes a $100M share-buyback program.

    Nordson (NDSN +3.2%) pops after its board authorizes a $100M share-buyback program.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • SVM

    Silvercorp (SVM -11.7%) is falling hard after Alfred Little issues a bearish report questioning...

    Silvercorp (SVM -11.7%) is falling hard after Alfred Little issues a bearish report questioning the company's "production, quality and resource estimates" for a Chinese mine, and claiming much of the company's sales growth has come from "two questionable customers." (.pdf)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 6 Comments
  • FITB

    Fifth Third Bancorp (FITB +3%) shares are raised to Outperform at RBC Capital, noting that...

    Fifth Third Bancorp (FITB +3%) shares are raised to Outperform at RBC Capital, noting that "FITB is attractively valued relative to peers, well positioned to grow, while being defensively positioned should the economic recovery stall." Nomura upgraded FITB a week ago. Regional banks (KRE +2%) are some of the S&P's best early performers: CMA +5%, FHN +4.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • RA-OLD

    RailAmerica (RA-OLD +2.7%) is trading higher this morning after saying the rate of decline in...

    RailAmerica (RA-OLD +2.7%) is trading higher this morning after saying the rate of decline in its carload traffic was much more restrained than in July, and excluding a big dip in coal it would have risen.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • TDG

    TransDigm Group (TDG +1.5%) is up this morning after S&P affirms its B+ rating and revises...

    TransDigm Group (TDG +1.5%) is up this morning after S&P affirms its B+ rating and revises its outlook to stable, citing strong margins, improving market conditions and an earnings boost from an acquisition.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • OMX

    Office supply chains OfficeMax (OMX +5.4%) and Office Depot (ODP +3.9%) are posting gains after...

    Office supply chains OfficeMax (OMX +5.4%) and Office Depot (ODP +3.9%) are posting gains after OfficeMax updates its guidance. The company says H2 sales will be slightly higher than last year, and the adjusted operating income margin rate will be flat to slightly higher. Sales for Q3 are expected to be slightly lower than last year's total.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • UFPI

    Universal Forest Products (UFPI +1.5%) is up this morning after saying it plans to...

    Universal Forest Products (UFPI +1.5%) is up this morning after saying it plans to re-consolidate its operations into two divisions from three. The move is part of an ongoing effort to streamline operations and expand its product mix.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • ANTM

    WellPoint (WLP +2.2%) and Humana (HUM +1.6%) both trade higher after confirming their FY11...

    WellPoint (WLP +2.2%) and Humana (HUM +1.6%) both trade higher after confirming their FY11 earnings views in separate filings with the SEC. The health-benefits providers have already raised guidance at least once this year, benefiting from reduced patient traffic due to a weakening economy. (I, II).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • MSFT

    LinkedIn (LNKD +3%) spikes higher on reports it may combine its online job recruitment business...

    LinkedIn (LNKD +3%) spikes higher on reports it may combine its online job recruitment business with Facebook.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • CMI

    Engine manufacturer Cummins (NYSE:CMI) is up 6.4% after setting 2015 targets of $30B in sales...

    Engine manufacturer Cummins (NYSE:CMI) is up 6.4% after setting 2015 targets of $30B in sales (reflecting an annual growth rate of 14%) and an EBIT margin of 18%. COO Tom Linebarger also notes at an investor meeting that the company is setting financial targets for 2011 exceeding what it originally planned to achieve in 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • BNPQY

    BNP Paribas (OTCQX:BNPQY) rebounds from sharp early losses following an unnamed official...

    BNP Paribas (OTCQX:BNPQY) rebounds from sharp early losses following an unnamed official claiming the bank was having serious dollar funding issues. Shares in Paris are 15% off early morning lows, now +1.2%. SocGen (OTCPK:SCGLY) +9.1% in Paris.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • QRE

    QR Energy (QRE +11.1%) pops after the company is added to the Alerian MLP Index and Baird...

    QR Energy (QRE +11.1%) pops after the company is added to the Alerian MLP Index and Baird upgrades shares to Outperform from Neutral. It's setting up like a banner week for the MLP oil concern after it also added an acquisition to its holdings.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • HA

    Hawaiian Airlines (HA +1.9%) gets a big boost from its service to Japan, according to...

    Hawaiian Airlines (HA +1.9%) gets a big boost from its service to Japan, according to information filed by the company with the SEC. The carrier now expects the Japan routes to contribute to a 12.5%-15.5% increase in passenger unit revenue, up from a previous estimate of 6.5%-9.5%. Shares are up 9.5% over the last 5 trading days.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • JVA

    Coffee Holding Co. (NASDAQ:JVA) gains 2.9% after reporting FQ3 revenue of $35.8M (+88% Y/Y) and...

    Coffee Holding Co. (NASDAQ:JVA) gains 2.9% after reporting FQ3 revenue of $35.8M (+88% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.03, with sales growth driven by a combination of higher coffee prices and volumes. Gross margin declined to 6.2% from 14.8% in the year-ago period, partly due to unrealized losses on coffee hedging transactions. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • HTZ

    Shares of Hertz (HTZ +3.1%) move higher as the company continues its quest to acquire Dollar...

    Shares of Hertz (HTZ +3.1%) move higher as the company continues its quest to acquire Dollar Thrifty (DTG +0.4%) via a tender offer. The company's 8-K filed with the SEC in conjunction with an investor meeting paints a rosy picture of synergies created if the merger is completed.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • KSU

    Shares of Kansas City Southern (KSU +2%) get a lift from Citi with an upgrade to Buy from Hold...

    Shares of Kansas City Southern (KSU +2%) get a lift from Citi with an upgrade to Buy from Hold on valuation. The firm sees double-digit revenue growth and "best in class" margins in store for the railroad company.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • SODA

    SodaStream (NASDAQ:SODA) is up 5.1% premarket after Janney starts coverage on the personal soda...

    SodaStream (NASDAQ:SODA) is up 5.1% premarket after Janney starts coverage on the personal soda machine maker with a Buy and $60 PT. The firm likes SodaStream's growth, retail expansion, and improving margins. The company received positive commentary last week from Oppenheimer and J.P. Morgan.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • SODA

    Premarket gainers: SODA +6%. UBS +5%. MU +4%. DB +4%. ING +3%. MGM +3%.Losers: BBVA -3%. CTIC -3%.

    Premarket gainers: SODA +6%. UBS +5%. MU +4%. DB +4%. ING +3%. MGM +3%.
    Losers: BBVA -3%. CTIC -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • LXRX

    Shares of Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:LXRX) move 3% higher premarket after the firm reports...

    Shares of Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:LXRX) move 3% higher premarket after the firm reports positive data from a clinical trial of its LX4211 treatment for Diabetes.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM

  • Sharply higher after a lame bond auction this morning, Italian bond yields begin falling on...

    Sharply higher after a lame bond auction this morning, Italian bond yields begin falling on hopes for something positive out of the Merkozy announcement. The Italian two-year yield is 20bps higher at 4.71%, from 4.81% earlier. The 10-year 11bps higher at 5.68%, vs. 5.77% earlier.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 AM

  • A weak Europe open sends futures lower. After a couple hours, London -0.5%, Frankfurt -0.2%, and...

    A weak Europe open sends futures lower. After a couple hours, London -0.5%, Frankfurt -0.2%, and Paris -1.5% as French banks remain in focus. S&P futures -1% to 1146. Crude +0.45% to $88.60. Gold flat at $1,814. Dollar is -0.3% vs. a basket of currencies but higher against the pound.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 AM
